etymology.description: 大(大) (dà, "big"), 力(力) (lì, "strength"), 士(士) (shì, "scholar; man")
etymology.interpretation: 大力士(大力士) (dàlìshì, "strongman") is a term for someone with great physical power, combining 大(大) (dà, "big") to denote magnitude, 力(力) (lì, "strength") for power, and 士(士) (shì, "man") to indicate a person who has these qualities.

examples.chinese: 大力士举起重物(大力士舉起重物)。
examples.english: The strongman lifts a heavy object.

examples.chinese: 在比赛中(在比賽中)，大力士奋力一举击倒对手(大力士奮力一舉擊倒對手)。
examples.pinyin: Zài bǐsài zhōng, dàlìshì fènlì yī jǔ jī dǎo duìshǒu.
examples.english: During the competition, the strongman knocked down his opponent with a powerful lift.

examples.chinese: 大力士的力量让人惊叹(大力士的力量讓人驚嘆)。
examples.pinyin: Dàlìshì de lìliàng ràng rén jīngtàn.
